intro: Hilliella sinuata subsp. qianwuensis, commonly known as the Qianwu hilliella, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
